name: Feel-Good Fables and Fantasies Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 'Field of Dreams', who is the 'featured' baseball player?
questions.explanation:
Joe Jackson.

	Great fantasy - and the ultimate in movies that let you walk out of the theatre feeling good.

questions.text: 'If you build it, he will come'. The 'you' refers to the Kevin Costner character. Who did 'he' turn out to be?
questions.explanation:
His father.

	Father and son reunion. Well done.

questions.text: Who played the crusty baseball manager in 'The Natural'?
questions.explanation:
Wilford Brimley.

	'Nice' movie. All four are classic curmudgeons, but it was Brimley in this one. (Wasn't he good in 'Absence of Malice'?)

questions.text: Who wrote the story on which 'The Natural' was based?
questions.explanation:
Bernard Malamud.

	'We all lead two lives: the life we learn with - and the life we are left with after'. Great line.

questions.text: Who starred in (the best version of) 'A Christmas Carol', released in 1951?
questions.explanation:
Alastair Sim.

	Brilliant acting. Great piece of work when he discovers that he has 'returned' and goes a bit nuts.

questions.text: The ultimate movie of this type may be 'It's A Wonderful Life'. Who was the director?
'Heaven Can Wait' starred Warren Beatty in a re-make of another movie. Who starred in the original movie?
questions.explanation:
Robert Montgomery.

	The second one had more of 'that feeling'.

questions.text: Which actor was NOT in the cast of the Beatty version of 'Heaven Can Wait'?
questions.explanation:
Richard Benjamin.

	Grodin had the Benjamin type role in this one.

questions.text: What does Rod Taylor take with him when he returns to the future in 'The Time Machine'?
questions.explanation:
Books.

	Books - but which ones? Fun movie. Delightful Taylor.

questions.text: Michael Douglas plays a pleasant chief executive in 'The American President'. Who plays his political rival?
